DataElement.preferredName: Metastatic Lesion Therapy Modality Administered Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A specific action or administration of an agent or to produce an effect that is intended to alter the pathologic process of a tumor(s) arising at a location that is distant from the primary lesion.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to an action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the pathologic process of a  tumor (s)arising at a location distant to the primary lesion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor arising at a location distant to the primary lesion.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A tumor arising at a location distant to the primary lesion.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: A specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, any therapeutic agent or method of treatment, especially involving the physical treatment of a condition.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, any therapeutic agent or method of treatment, especially involving the physical treatment of a condition.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type related to the specific action or administration of an agent to treat a lesion that is distant to the primary tumor. .

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stereotactic radiation therapy in which one or several maximum dose radiation treatments are delivered targeting cancers of the body, excluding the brain or spine.

Concepts.definition: Stereotactic radiation therapy in which one or several maximum dose radiation treatments are delivered targeting cancers of the body, excluding the brain or spine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

PermissibleValues.value: Both surgery and SBRT to different metastatic lesions

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Made or joined or united into one or involving the joint activity of two or more.

Concepts.definition: Made or joined or united into one or involving the joint activity of two or more.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
